text: On draft. Pours a mostly clear dark brown pour and topped by a small beige colored head of foam that slowly settles to a thin film. The aroma is nice showing notes of toasted apples, caramelized sugars, cinnamon spice, a hint of maple, toasted vanilla and burnt caramel malts. The flavor follows suit with the with the cinnamon, vanilla, and burnt sugars up front to go with the caramel apples and sweet toffee malts from the base brown ale. Medium bodied and smooth with subtle carbonation that leads to a sweet caramel apple and cinnamon finish. Tasty brown ale that makes you want a nice slice of apple pie to go with it.
Pours a light amber color. Aromas of hop, apples with hints of grass and malts. Flavor has a nice spicybite to it, with a mellow apple flavor with a nice dry finish.
Draft at source - pours reddish amber - nose/taste of apple, cinnamon, vanilla and pie crust - med body
Draft. Nose is moderate cinnamon. Light fruitiness. Slightly vanilla. Hazy deep red to brown. Taste is apples and cubanonnn. A tad thin. Ok.

Taster glass 4oz at brewery
A - hazy brown small head 
A - apple cinnamon dough, yeast
T - smooth, no bitterness, mild sweetness, desert like beer, vanilla, caramel
P - mild to medium body, no carbonation, silky texture
O - tasted better than I would have imagined, I'd drink plenty of this great fall/winter beer

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Hazy brown color with off white head. Malty aroma, fruity, spicy, cinnamon, caramel, light vanilla. Sweet taste like aroma, spicy, apple. Light to medium oily body with sot carbonation.

Medium brown, aroma is spicy like a bit of cinnamon and pepper, vanilla too I swear. That character is assertive, with a little hit of apple...more like a breakfast cereal than beer. The brown ale simply does not come out enough. No balance.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey for the Cigar City & Funky Buddha SAVOR event. Dark brown with light tan head. Aromas of light apples, spice. Tastes of apples, caramel, toffee. Medium body with a dry finish.
Draft. Dark pour with white head. Cinnamon, vanilla, spice, Apple and othe fruit aromas. Sweet vanilla, Apple, light cinnamon and spice flavors.

Bonita apple bum, you gotta put me on. Bonita Bonita Bonita... Nobody does strange gimmick beers like funky Buddha, and they actually do it well. Apple and light pie malt. Nice balance. Tap at Churchkey.
Tap at WOB. Dark brown pour with a thick off white head. Sweet Apple, cinnamon and brown sugar aroma. Smooth sweet malt, lots of apples, roasted grain and brown sugar taste. Really good.

Draught @ CBC 2014 [ Yellow Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Funky Buddha Bonita Applebum ].Murky matt medium brown color. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, cinnamon, apple - BBQ apple ala Ulfborg - German apfelstrudel. Flavour is heavy sweet with a long duration, big time cinnamon, apple - BBQ apple ala Ulfborg - German apfelstrudel. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. I like German apfelstrudel - so I like this beer also ;D [20140502]

Sample @ CBC 2014. Pours dark reddish brown with a tan head. Aroma is apple pie with lots of apple, cinnamon, caramel and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet caramel, apple, cinnamon, finish is short with sweet caramel and dried apple notes. Great apple pie infused beer.
Draught at MikkellerBar. Clear brown - tight offwhite head. Apple. Sourish. Roasted. Sweetness. Roasted. Caramel. Ok spicy. Fruity. Nutty. Ok bitterness. Wierd.
On tap at CBC 2014. Hazy orange with off white head. Aroma of apples, apfelstrudel, cinnamon, sugar, butter. Taste is sweet, a tad too much spice, apples.

On tap at the brewery in February. Pours a hazy orange/brown with a small tan head. The smell is spicy apple, brown sugar. The taste is like Faygo Rock n Rye soda. Spicy apple, brown sugar and cola. Medium body with average carbonation.
From tap. Pours hazy brown with a small off white head. Aroma is mild citric, roasted malty and breadish. Sweet, bubblegu, and fruity. Toasted malty and sweet. Fruity and bubblegum finish.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. 
Clear red-brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and nuts.
Fruity flavour of caramel, nuts and bread with notes of berries.
Sweet finish.

Draft. A hazy red-brown beer with a huge tan head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, lemons, and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of brown sugar, bread, alcohol, and over ripe fruits, leading to a bitter finish.

2nd May 2014CBC Session 1. Clear deep amber beer, small pale cream coloured head. Palate is light, crisp and dry. Dry sweet malt cream. Sweet spice. Mild apple. Finishes dry and crisp. Yep - definitely an Apple Pie beer!

Sweet caramel malty, toffee, cinnamon, brown sugar nice apple nuance throughout this. (D15)

Tap sample at CBC 2014. Deep clear amber body, small off-white head. Nose is roasted apple pie crust, apples, cinnamon and hints of nuts and straw. Nice. Taste is similar, with apple pie tones of cinnamon, pie crust, bisquits and hints of herbs in the back. Medium but slightly watery body, medium carbonation. Cool liquid recreation of an apple pie! :-D
Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 1st Session. Pours brown with a beige head, aroma of apple pie with a dough, flavor of apple pie and dough, medium bodied.

[5/2/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 1st session. Amber. Aroma of caramelized apples, cinnamon, nutmeg and clove. Sweet flavor, caramelly and spicy with apples. Medium-bodied. Interesting but not my thing.
CBC. Unclear brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, cinnamon and apple pie. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 020514

Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Clear dark reddish shade with a thin cap. Really nice aroma with malts, brown sugar and cinnamon. Taste brings that forward and adds an apple twist. Maybe date/raisin fruitiness too. Wow, this is pretty successful at what it wants to be.

Draft @ CBC 2014. Pours a hazy amber brown color with a small off-white head. has a fruity spicy apple and cinnamon aroma with hints of caramel. Fruity malty spicy apple crumble flavor with hints of caramel. Has a fruity malty spicy apple and cinnamon finish.

Draft at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Session 1. Pours clear amber with a frothy, off-white head. Gorgeous cinnamon and apple crumble aroma. Medium sweet flavor with more apple crumble character. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish with caramel, rich apples, coffee cake, cinnamon, vanilla frosting. Delicious stuff. It is what it is.

Draught @ CBC 2014. Pours murky brown with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, grilled apples, vanilla, cinnamon. Flavor is malts, sweet apples, caramel , spice, cinnamon. Thinb to medium body, average carbonation. Sweet and light spicy beer. 020514
Tap @ CBC, 14. Dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, nut, apple and candy. Flavour is malt, caramel, nut, sweet, sugar, wood and candy.

Draught at CBC 2014. Light hazy amber liquid with a medium off-white head. Aroma of butter, apples, cinnamon and vanilla. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of cinnamon, apples and vanilla. Light bodied with medium carbonation. Nice, totally tastes like apple pie.

brown appearance, toilet water, cinnamon nose and nutmeg. very christmasy with some maple and brown sugar. taste is nice some apple strudel / turnover, pears and honey crisp. too sweet but weak finish.

Draught at CBC.
A novelty beer with the taste of apple pie, ie vanilla, apples, cinnamon,muskot and a little chcolate.

CBC 2014. Pours caramel with no head. Aroma of apple, cinnamon, vanilla, caramel, candi sugar. Taste is apple, vanilla,cinnamon, caramel. Apple Pie!! Mouth is sprighly yet smooth with medium carbonation. Aftertaste is, well, apple pie!
Sample @ CBC. Actually tastes and smells like apple pie!? Which is good. A lot of fun!

Pours deep brownish amber with low off-white head. Aroma of apple pie... cinnamon, vanilla, apples, caramel and toffee. Taste is mild sweet, vanilla and apples. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Copenhagen beer festival... Hazy brown.. Thin tan head... Dark sweet roast... Soft apple... Daek fruits... Soft fruuts... Bug berries and spuced apple pie

Growler thanks to Matt. Pours a dark amber with medium white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is strong apple, cinnamon, and crusts. Medium mouthfeel with strong apple pie flavor, cinnamon, and light spice. Very good.

Une bière brune acajou. Un anneau de mousse. Un nez qui me fait plier le genou. Wow! Je nai jamais senti quelque chose de semblable dans une bière. Véritablement, cest une pointe de tarte aux pommes épicées sur laquelle repose une boule de crème glacée à la vanille fondante. Complètement débile! Et que dire du coulis de sirop dérable qui me coule entre les narines! En bouche, cest aussi exceptionnel. Cidre de pommes, touche acidulée, croûte de tarte, cannelle, muscade et joggeuse cubaine sont des éléments que je noublierai pas de sitôt. En bouche, le liquide occupe un espace considérable mais il nest jamais lourd. Une véritable caresse pour la bouche. La finale nest jamais sucrée, très savoureuse, incroyablement complexe. Excessivement facile à boire. Une bière étoilée si ce nest pas quelque chose comme un chef doeuvre. Sublime.

Poured from a tap. Dark brown color, nice full frothy tan head. Malt and apple with spice aroma. Nutty brown chocolate with spice body and a nice sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Backlog bottle thanks to so many good ratebeerians. The smell is cinnamon, spice, apple, pie, and nice. Sort of incredible. The look is clear, brown in color, and has an off white head. The taste is dessert, apples, pine, fried pie, and good.

Growler @ Richards tasting. Gonna have to homer this one up, Flow-Rida style. Dark amber pour with a khaki head. Wow. Amazing apple pie nose. Cinnamon, apple, pie crust, and caramel. Flavor is liquid apple pie. Light fruit tartness, cinnamon, baked apple, pie crust, and sugar. Great.
Tap at Proof. This shit is like drinking my grandmas homemade apple pie and its goddamn delicious.

On tap at the FL Tap Invitational at Proof! Pours a hazy copper brown with bubbly white head that leaves light lace. Aroma is straight apple pie, cinnamon and sugar with baked apples over it all. Taste follows, but great balance and not too crazy sweet. This is an awesome beer, wow.

Florida beer invitation! Dark hazy ruby brown. Smells like a Yankee candle apple pie. Baked apples and cinnamon. Sweet but not overly sweet or cloyingly. Reminds me a bit of the dehydrated cinnamon apple chips. I could see beers like this replacing pumpkin beers as fall seasonal.
Brown pour at FB. Tastes of a cinnamon heavy apple pie. Even the crust flavor seemed to be there. Unique and fun.
Rated in April 2012 (Backlog) - Amber in color with a small off-white head. Aroma is of apple cinnamon struesel. Taste is the same.
On draft at the brewery, first miss for me, alcohol and cinnamon is all I could taste, I had in mind something like new glares apple pie ale and no way

At brewery grand opening.  Overall solid beer but in comparison to other FB brews I had that night, not overwhelming.  Lacked the apple flavor punch I was expecting.  Slight hints of apple, cinnamon and vanilla.
Murky brown, beige head. Nose is apple pie, vanilla, cinnamon. Matching taste with red fruits, sweet, somewhat metallic finish. A good beer, but Muy Bonita is much better than its little brother.

On draft at Churchkey in D.C.

The beer is orange to auburn in color with a small head that leaves little in the way of lacing. The aroma brings a heavy dose of cinnamon and nutmeg. Apples emerge more in the flavor. Bready and sweet. This beer is dominated by spice. Cinnamon and nutmeg overrun other more subtle flavors. Thin body with low carbonation. Unbalanced. Mediocre.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 07-03-2012

On tap at Churchkey (Wash. DC).  Pours a slightly cloudy deep auburn color capped with a one finger off white head that leaves some good lacing.  The aroma was comprised of sweet malt, apple, bread, sugar, and cinnamon.  Plenty of apple flavor up front with a smooth sweetness. Lots of spice with cinnamon and nutmeg, which really creates a nice apple pie taste. Biscuit and pie crust tones in the malt with more sugary apple notes towards the finish.  Smooth mouthfeel, with a medium body and good carbonation.

Bottle thanks to erica..Pour is amber with a offwhite cream head..Nose is apple pie, pie crust, cinnamon, spices..Taste is apples, apple pie, gram cracker, pie crust, sweet and very balanced and complex..palate is warm apple pie..Wow this is amazing

Draft at Prohibition Taproom in Philadelphia, PA. 

Pours a dark golden amber color with tangerine edges and a two finger light beige head.  Great retention only slowly fading into a lasting ring. Streaks of soapy lace left behind. 

Spicy autumnal aroma with tons of cinnamon, ginger and clove along with sweet apples and light malt.  Apple chutney sweetness along with caramel, toffee, cinnamon, apple pie and graham cracker. 

Medium body thats bursting with sweet and spicy apple pie flavor.  Lots of cinnamon, ginger, clove and nutmeg along with sweet apple pie filling.   Sweet malt notes underneath as well with some caramel, toffee and hazelnut lingering into a slightly dry finish.  Another great experimental dessert beer from these guys.  They really nailed the aroma and flavors but at the same time it still feels like a beer.  Excellent!
bottle thanks to ericandersnavy.  deep amber pour, cream head.  nose is apple strudel, cinnamon, fresh apples.  great on the palate, cinnamon apples, crust, cookies.

Deep amber red/brown pour thin off white head ... aroma of apple pie and cinnamon/nutmeg spices ... tastes the same as the aroma with an intense cinnamon spice and pie crust, nutmeg and just a hint of roasted flavor  ... finishes sweet and dry with lingering cinnamon spice and apple ... apple pie in a glass this stuff was awesome and highly sessionable

On tap at Churchkey.  Served in a mini snifter.  Pours a medium brown color with a thin head.  Spotty lacing.  The nose has a pretty hefty amount of spice and some underlying apple.  Loads of nutmeg and other pumpkin-pie type spices really take this one over the tap.  Flavor has some sweetness and a bit of a caramel apple thing, but the spices are way out front.  Too much going on; just a total crapshoot.  Not a fan.
Draft courtesy of GT2, thank you sir!  Cloudy brown, almost flat. Aroma of spiced brown bread, cinnamon and nutmeg. Taste is similar.

Draft.  Cloudy copper body, small tan head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, apple, some cinnamon, pie crust.  Taste is moderately sweet, apple, some cinnamon, light allspice.  Light-medium body, light stickiness.  It had every bit the smell of an apple pie, but the flavor couldnt quite replicate the experience provided by the nose.

Draft at Churchkey for the Bluejacket/Funky Buddha/Cigar City event during SAVOR week. Poured a kind of dull orange color with a small, almost wispy head. Aroma was like cooked spiced apples, apple and cinnamon and brown sugar are certainly are in there - and whatever kinds of spices that might appear in a pumpkin pie like allspice or clove or something.

Tap at CK. Hazy ugly mahogany. Weak yellow foam. Nose is more apple pie crust with butter, cinnamon, spicy. Taste is heavy pie crust, spicy. Not really apple pie as much as nice pie crust. A lot of cinnamon/nutmeg/Clove but not medicinal. Very nice. Palae is a bit sweet. Heavy brown sugar. Cloven bitterness. Not bad. Not very bright like NG Apple Ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Tapestry and Prohibition. Pours a swampy brown color. Not a ton of lacing or head but it was present. Aromas of strong cinnamon, apple pie, oats, and malt. Taste is CC oatmeal raisin cookie with cherries mostly, other smaller notes of chocolate, vanilla, red cooking apples, sugar, spicy woods.

Pours unclear dark somewhat ruby amber with a decent creamy tan head. The aroma brings beautiful sweet apple butter and cinnamon all over the nose. The flavor brings sweet apple and malts blended so well together with a nice cinnamon presence really rounding it out so well on a somewhat juicy and excellently carbonated body.

On draft at Prohibition. Pours reddish brown with a thin tan head. Nose is like apple cider, cinnamon, apples, nutmeg. Taste is strong mulling spices, cloves come through, apples. Really different 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

draft at Tapestry for Philly Beer Week. Pours a murky borwn. Nose is hot cider, nutmeg and a boozy quality. First sip is hard cider, and apple pie shooter mminus whipe cream, malty toastec flavors, boozy almost vodka like the apple pie shooter, finish is cinnamon and doughy flavors. nice

Draft at tapestry with Vinny and Scott during PBW. Pours a deep, murky brown body with thin off white lacing. Aroma is straight up apple pie, cinnamon, and crust. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of apple cider, apple pie, cinnamon, nutmeg and crust.

On tap at the Hulmeville Inn.  Clearish brown with some white froth.  Nose is apple, toffee and cinnamon.  Medium body with mild carb.  Taste is apple and cinnamon, ginger but not quite sweet.  Finishes slightly bitter; im thinking Dr. Pepper.  Love the muted sweetness of this one.

On draft at the HI. Pours a deep honey caramel amber with a medium sized off white head. Beautiful aroma of apple cinnamon strudel, warm apple crumb pie and a hint of nutmeg. Taste is dominated by apple cinnamon delight.  Excellent stuff.

Bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. Pours with a tan head over a hazed brown hued body. Aromas are sweet, cereal, apple, brown sugar, nutty, cinnamon and nutmeg. Very pie like. Not cloying or too heavy. Flavors are nutty, graham crackers, apple, cinnamon, nutty, caramel, nutmeg. Very nice flavors. Like a light version of a Rocky Mountain Brewing Co beer. Medium bubbles, not too oppressive on the finish. Good!

Bottled shared at bu11zeyes 10,000th rating tasting. Thanks to ericandersnavy for sharing. 

The beer pours a brown color with a tan head. The aroma is awesome, with a ton of cinnamon and apples. The flavor is also great but is more complex. I get a lot of apple and cinnamon, as well as some oak, vanilla and rum notes. There is also some nice alcohol flavor as well as a good bit of sweetness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Very nice.

(22oz bottle, courtesy of ericandersnavy)  Pours a cloudy amber body with a small cream head.  Aroma of apple, cinnamon toasted crunch cereal, and caramel.  Flavor of apple, cinnamon, caramel, and pie crust.

Draft back in August of last year with Hopscotch at the Buddha.  Ryan was nice enough to pour a sample glass for Eric, Laura, and myself before it was officially released.  Hazy brown pour with a nice tan head.  The aromas is straight up apple pie with a buttery sweet crust.  All kinds of sweet baked apples, cinnamon, brown sugar, caramel malt, and a hint of the buttery crust that Eric keeps pointing out.  Just another deliciously diabolical concoction from the mad geniuses at the Funky Buddha.  Kudos Ryan and Kevin......
bottle, from ericandersnavy, orange color , this is Tillie Taylors struedel in a glass, cocoa smooth finish
Bottle from ericandersnavy.  Murky brown pour with a big tan head.  This whole thing is just tons of cinnamon, apples, sweetness, and baking spice.

(22oz bomber thanks to ericandersnavy) cloudy brown with lasting offwhite head. Nose of cinnamon apples, rich and flavorful, cinnamon toast crunch, smells great. Taste of big cinnamon, apples, lots of spices, tastes just delicious. Wow. Huge amazing amounts of flavor, just ridiculously delicious.

Fantastic. Was really surprised by this one. Not a big fan of fruit beer, but this was terrific. Huge! cinnamon apple raisin nose. Flavor like drinking an apple pie with extra caramel and cinnamon, very bready. Awesome awesome beer! Too bad Funky Buddha doesnt do growlers. If you have not been to FB brewery/lounge and you live in Florida, you should definitely go. Relaxing chill place with some great unique beer.

I wasnât sure what to expect from this beer. I am not a fan of Apple in my drinks, but this beer certainly made me re-evaluate my taste. The nose is gorgeous, it captures the intoxicating scent of Apple Pie. It opens with Apple on the front, but blossoms to cinnamon and carmel as it comes to its finish. The balance of this is remarkable, and despite my initial thoughts that this would be a heavy thick drinking beer, it was medium bodied with complexity that kept manifesting throughout the offering.

Aroma is cinnamon, fruit, and slightly doughy. Flavor is apple pie... all the elements come through one after another finishing with a slight vanilla bean aftertaste. Absolutely amazing set of flavors that are all distinctly noticeable.

Pouring at the Saturday afternoon session of EBF.  Pours a hazed brown amber with a thin beige head.  Ginger bread cookies, cinnamon and graham crackers.  Sweet apple pie flavors, tastes like spiced mulled cider complete with the warm rum notes.  Wood and toast, lingering cinnamon.  Very tasty, but after the first three of their beers, this one had a tough time keeping up.

Bottle... Light brown, watery light tan head... The aroma is Cinnamon apple pie, lots of apple chunks, burnt brown sugar, a little vanilla and star anise too... Tastes more spicy, lots anise and cinnamon, loses most of the apples, could have balanced with more apples, finish with brandy and clove... Tastes like its supposed too but too much dessert like to drink more than a few ounces 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Funky Buddha has done it again. Bonita Applebum is, simply put, dessert in a glass. All the familiar aromas and spices of apple pie - cinnamon, nutmeg, buttery crust, apple (obviously), along with just the right amount of alcohol. The slight apple tartness plays well with the spice and a low-key sweetness and its all reminiscent of caramel apple pie. Theyd be insane not to eventually offer this as a float with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, but the beer itself needs no improvement. The only downside to me is that apple-cinnamon is not my favorite flavor profile so its not as easy for me to drink more than one glass like I would with many of their other beers. The geniuses at Funky Buddha have received national attention for their Maple Bacon Coffee Porter and No Crusts PB&J ale, and Bonita should be the next huge hit.

Nice rich dark brown color, but rather  sweet and over exaggerated and 
overbearing with the fruity taste, but masks the alcohol well at 6 %.
12 ounce draft at the happy hour for $5.50 Mcpie? Too sweet, not really my style.
This apple pie beer tastes and smells exactly like apple pie.  I think that is all that needs to be said, pretty impressive.

This beer and vanilla ice cream would be the perfect dessert. The beer is murky brown in color. This beer smells awesome with apples, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Its taste about the same as it smells with some added caramel. Its smells like a super sweet beer, but its really very drinkable. Now where is my ice cream!!!

On draft at Cigar City for Fruit in the Room 2011.  Pours a translucent brown with an off-white head.  Nose is sharp candied apples, cinnamon, nutmeg, and caramel.  Flavor is similar- a light brown ale backing a tremendous burst of candied apples, big cinnamon, caramel, and spice.  Light in body and a tremendously smooth apple and cinnamon finish.

Ridiculous beer (in a good way!). Fruit in the Room 2011. Smelled amazing! Loads of cinnamon apple sauce, grainy malt, an indescribable sweetness, and some raisins. Reminded me of a well made apple cobbler. Spot on for sure. Poured a dark brown and light brown head. Tasted fantastic like apple pie a la mode. This one had loads of spice and some apple fruitiness that was incredibly pleasing to the palate. How do they do this??

Wow, had at Cigar City fruit in the room.  Aroma is cinnamon and apples.  Tastes like as if you went to applebees and get the apple crisp and the left over syrup with icecream was left.  You know how you scrape the iron skillet to get the last vanillia icecream, apple cinnamon syrup... well that is this beer pretty amazing...
Growler at Maltzillas tasting. Pours cloudy light caramel color with off white head. Smells like apple pie. Baked apple, cinnamon and graham carckers. Medium body with lively carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2011 Draft... Murky brown ale with a mid-sized, creamy, khaki head. Decent retention. The bouquet is straight up apple pie, crust and all  cinnamon, brown sugar, apples and buttery graham. Full-bodied and silky with gentle carbonation. The flavor is a swirl of red apple, brown sugar and cinnamon flanked by moderate malic acid tartness and mild tannic bitterness. Finishes bittersweet and tangy with a kiss of graham crust. I miss my mom! :*(

A near perfect beer. The base beer for this is Doc Brown. Beers actual name is Bonita Applebaum. Pours a very murky kinda ugly looking brown with a big creamy foamy head. The nose is ridiculous, fresh baked apples and cinnamon with a tough of biscuit and nutmeg. The flavor profile is where you get a bit of a problem but its very slight. Huge baked apples and cinnamon up front, big thick creamy mouthfeel, this tastes almost nothing like the base beer, its just super thick and creamy. The only thing I dont like is it finishes with a bit of odd tannic bitterness, but the apple finish keeps it from being annoying. Still the bitterness doesnt really fit with this beer, other than that its amazing.

Big thanks to Ryan for sharing this with us before its even released. When the guys at the Buddha make a "apple pie" beer you expect it to taste just like an apple pie and thats exactly what they did. This is by far one of the best creations theyve come  up with thus far. Incredible aroma and flavor, apple pie all the way. Wouldnt change a thing about this beer.
